提交信息: test: player: pause: ensure outputs are paused via timers  And that no frame is rendered once we receive the PAUSED event.
test: player: timers: add smpte.on_paused

test: player: timers: add wait helpers  Current timer tests are fetching reports when the player is stopped and does not require any lock or wait mechanism. Add lock/cond and helpers in order to allow fetching timer reports when the player is running.
player: handle pause events from outputs  And remove the hack that forced the es_source when paused.  Each timers will now receive the pause event from its es_source.
es_out: implement on_output_paused
input: add INPUT_EVENT_OUTPUT_STATE event  To notify that an output is paused from the decoder.
decoder: add on_output_paused event
player: add on_paused event for timer_smpte
aout: assert Play() is not called paused
es_out: remove always true argument

tools: allow newer major versions  When the user has CMake 4.x we should not build CMake 3.x because we require at least 3.21.0.  This matching major version was introduced for protoc in ee5fad6a354d4fde1bb98f715e0455c603599554. But it has moved to contribs and other tools (not matching a library) should be backward compatible.  If there is another tool that needs to match the major version exactly, we should at a special check for that.

qml: fix anchoring of the layer effect in `MainDisplay`  This bug is currently asymptomatic because `stackViewParent` and `mainRow` (its parent) have the same size.  We can anchor to the sibling like we do for visual parent, so this is a trivial fix.

demux: image: fix JFIF detection  A JFIF does not necessarily has an ICC Profile, and especially not usually directly following the SOI, as the spec requires SOI followed by the APP0 JFIF marker. So while this new detection logic fixes out-of-spec files that have a (small) ICC profile before the APP0 JFIF, it breaks most other properly structured ones.  This makes the APP0 ICC profile optional and continues looking for the APP0 JFIF regardless.  Regression from 5ffd36ffa26a83ae498373f7d0ace1d82ab952f4
misc/stats: ensure p_pic is non-NULL before calling decoder_QueueVideo()
demux: adaptive: handle broken PCR source at fakeesout level
demux: adaptive: set buffering level to committed dts on invalid PCR  Allows progression when we force set pcr to invalid
demux: adaptive: fix debug build
test: preparser: release thumbnail request after cancel test case
test: preparser: rename request names to avoid variable shadowing
aout: filters: use ARRAY_SIZE
opensles: use ARRAY_SIZE
audiounit_ios: use ARRAY_SIZE
alsa: use ARRAY_SIZE
xkb: use ARRAY_SIZE
egl_gbm: use ARRAY_SIZE
qt: player: use lambda to static initialize player cbs  cf. 1f743fa704be9c2d4cc2f1ecd20d0100a06355ed
qt: player: use lambda to static initialize smpte cbs  cf. 1f743fa704be9c2d4cc2f1ecd20d0100a06355ed
doc: libvlc: update minimum CMake to 3.10  Below 3.5 is not supported by current CMake and below 3.10 is mentioned as removed soon.

snap: fix snap package upload  `snapcraft login --with` and `snapcraft push` are deprecated  ``` $ echo $SNAP_LOGIN | base64 --decode | snapcraft login --with - --with is no longer supported, export the auth to the environment variable 'SNAPCRAFT_STORE_CREDENTIALS' instead Login successful $ snapcraft push nightlies/vlc_*.snap --release edge The 'push' command was renamed to 'upload'. Use 'upload' instead. The old name will be removed in a future release. Credentials are no longer valid for the Snap Store. ```  when using SNAPCRAFT_STORE_CREDENTIALS environment variable, login and logout aren't necessary

contrib: ffmpeg: don't force a CPU architecture with --cpu (-march)  In VLC 4 we use __builtin_clz() since a1245addb040c4f9f104e0fb57f72c6a8f034537.  But it's turned off for some old CPU architectures in FFmpeg [^1].  [^1]: https://code.ffmpeg.org/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/src/branch/release/7.1/configure#L6485
test: player: check AtoBLoop
test: player: timers: use helpers
test: player: add more timers helpers  Helper to create and listen to timer events.
test: player: common: handle report_length
test: player: handle timer on_seek events
mock: add report_length  Can be used to test a stream without a known (or exposed) length.

player: also handle AtoBLoop on EOF  The deadline (from the previous commit) can still be missed if the B position is very close to the end (or past the end).  This also fixes AtoBLoop when the length is not known, and near EOF (when only using positions).
player: finer AtoBLoop handling  Use the player timer to wait for the accurate B deadline.
player: check can_seek later on AtoBLoop requests  So that vlc_player_SetAtoBLoop() can be called when not started.
player: rework vlc_player_input_HandleAtoBLoop()  Can be forced to force the seek to the a position (not used for now) Returns true if it caused a seek.
player: return the seeking state from GetTimerPoint()
player: reorder calls in vlc_player_input_HandleAtoBLoop()  Avoid initializing variables if not needed.
player: expose vlc_player_input_HandleAtoBLoop()
player: refactor, merge vlc_player_input_HandleAtoBLoop()  No functional changes.
player: rename destructor to mainloop  This thread could be used for something else than stopping inputs.
display: rename VoutDisplayCreateRender() to VoutConverterCreate()  The function only deals with converters. This is the counterpart of VoutConverterRelease().
vout: rename GetAspectRatio() to vout_ParseDisplayAspectRatio()  In line with the existing vout_ParseCrop(). We also change the order of parameters to match that function.
video_output: remove trivial function  It didn't even mention it's the Display aspect ratio.
vout: pass the display aspect ratio as a vlc_rational_t  So the 2 values are always tied.
display: only compute the scaled dimensions when we use them
display: reduce line length and reorder variables  No functional changes.
demux: mkv: add support for LZO1X decompression via lzokay  lzokay [^1] is a C++ MIT-licensed library to (de)compress LZO1X.  [^1]: https://github.com/AxioDL/lzokay
demux: mkv: use VLC-like 16-bit little endian reader for lzo1x  In C++20 we could use std::endian [^1].  [^1]: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/types/endian.html
demux: mkv: use standard way to get size_t maximum for lzo1x
demux: mkv: remove unused lzo1x compression code
demux: mkv: add LZO1X decompression code from lzokay  lzokay [^1] is a C++ MIT-licensed library to (de)compress LZO1X.  [^1]: https://github.com/AxioDL/lzokay
oggspots: fix OOB read (unchecked image offset)  Fixes #29319
demux: ty: don't look for ES header past the input buffer boundaries
demux: ty: don't check for S1/S2 if the offsets are too large
demux: ty: stop read chunk if offset is past the data  Fixes https://code.videolan.org/videolan/vlc/-/issues/29316

cvdbsub: don't use metadata offset if bigger than whole SPU  ParseMetaInfo() will not parse anything in that case as p == p_end. The image will use the whole of the SPU buffer, potentially containing metadata at the end. But the reading in RenderImage() is constrained by the width/height so it won't use these data.  Fixes https://code.videolan.org/videolan/vlc/-/issues/29325

demux: aiff: return early if the allocation is not possible  We need to allocate i_data_size + 1. So i_data_size cannot be SIZE_MAX or higher.  Fixes https://code.videolan.org/videolan/vlc/-/issues/29317

demux: ogg: keep the map sizes when they are set  The p_old_map/p_new_map sizes should match their buffer size.  By default the channel counts are zero which considers the old/new maps match. The channel count read may be updated but not the channel mapping. We need to check the channel count match and the mapping matches.  Fixes https://code.videolan.org/videolan/vlc/-/issues/29314
cea708: fix CEA708_Window_Truncate()  Make truncation actually drop one column in LTR/RTL (adjust lastcol/firstcol; delete rows only when they become empty).  Fixes #29328
cea708: fix Window_MinCol()/Window_MaxCol() indexes  Refs #29328
cea708: fix OOB write in CEA-708 LTR window scroll  Due to wrong bound check  Fixes #29375
cea708: use 4-byte stride for 4-byte character cells  Fixes corruption/OOB. Fixes #29326
cea708: fix OOB write in CEA-708 RTL window scroll  Fixes #29323
cc: OOB read in CEA-708 CDP time_code_section  Fixes #29322
macosx: Add a gradient effect at the top of the play queue scroll view  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Match positioning and sizing of play queue footer with the main library window playback controls bar  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Add a glass effect for the play queue footer  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Create and configure a blurred background for the play queue footer  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>

vout/iOS: change run loop mode to kCFRunLoopCommonMode  This updates the video rendering loop in VLCOpenGLES2VideoView to use kCFRunLoopCommonMode instead of kCFRunLoopDefaultMode.  Using CADisplayLink with the default run loop mode causes frame updates to pause during common UI interactions, such as pulling down the control center. This results in frozen video even though audio continues normally.  Using kCFRunLoopCommonMode ensures frame updates even when the player is not in focus. This matches the behavior used by Apple in AVPlayer.
chromecast: Disable HEVC for original Chromecast devices
test: player: add eof.c  Test vlc_player_SetPlayAndPause() and vlc_player_SetRepeatCount()
libvlc: handle "input-repeat"
libvlc: handle "play-and-pause"
playlist: remove STOPPED_PAUSE  It's now 100% handled by the player.
player: add vlc_player_SetRepeatCount  The input_thread_t is not handling "input-repeat" anymore.
player: add vlc_player_SetPlayAndPause  The input_thread_t is not handling "play-and-pause" anymore.
input: add INPUT_CONTROL_RESET_POSITION

input: add external EOF handling  The INPUT_EVENT_EOF listener can return true if it handles the EOF itself. In that case, the input_thread_t will wait for any controls (input_Stop() will definitively stop it).  No changes if the event is not handled.
input: move EOF handling in else{}  No functional changes
input: refactor, add ResetPosition()  No functional changes.
input: refactor, use and rework StartTitle()  No functional changes.
input: move StartTitle up  To avoid forward declaration in the next commit.  No functional changes.

decoder: allow holding Fifo lock while sending events.  The Fifo lock can be held while calling `decoder_Notify()`. Therefore, don't try to avoid calling `decoder_Notify()` with the lock.  ``` vlc_input_decoder_t  => es_out.c (es_out lock can't be held from these callbacks)  => input_SendEvent(). ```

skins2: x11: use ARRAY_SIZE
qt: tests: use ARRAY_SIZE
qt: dialogs: use ARRAY_SIZE
gui: ncurses: uses ARRAY_SIZE
player: expose media stopping reason via on_stopping_current_media  Add an enum to expose whether media is stopping due to user request, reaching EOS or encountering an error.

player: report on_stopping_current_media for all stopping scenarios  Previously, on_stopping_current_media was emitted only when the user stopped the media. The callback notification is moved into vlc_player_input_HandleState, ensuring it is reported when media reaches EOS, errors out, or is stopped by the user.

player: call input_Stop before reporting the stopping state  Ensure that the player notifies the user about the stopping state after the underlying input_thread begins stopping. Also, this is required for the next commit, where the on_stopping_current_media event notification will be moved inside vlc_player_input_HandleState
CI: disable debian-contrib job  The snap package also builds the missing contribs. They are currently the same between the debian-contrib and the snap job, except the snap job also builds live555.

wav: fix invalid PCR when seeking to 0  Don't set the date to VLC_TICK_INVALID when seeking to 0.  This was causing an invalid PCR and a quick EOF. ``` [00007f4780091e20] main input debug: control type=15 [00007f4780091e20] main input debug: control type=3 [00007f4780091e20] main input debug: ES_OUT_RESET_PCR called [00005653d9251a90] [qt] qt generic debug: on_player_buffering [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! ... [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! [00007f4780091e20] main input error: Invalid PCR value in ES_OUT_SET_(GROUP_)PCR ! [00007f4780091e20] main input debug: EOF reached ```
decoder: fix possible and recent drained miss  Regression from 5eb0c9c48312bfb57bdf174c071a7f984f4ef7fe  `draining` should be checked from `vlc_input_decoder_IsDrainedLocked()`.

test: player: split all tests  Move each tests in a separate file/program.   - This will make debugging from the CI easier.  - This will allow running player tests in parallel  - This will fix timeout will one very long test, that could last more    than 10 seconds  - This will allow adding more tests, that could take more time  Fixes #27105
test: player: split code, add modules.c  To ease test split in a future commit.  No functional changes.  Refs #27105
test: player: split code, add timers.h  To ease test split in a future commit.  No functional changes.  Refs #27105
test: player: split code, add common.h  To ease test split in a future commit.  No functional changes.  Refs #27105

es_out: don't flush decoders if drained  As the doc says:  "The instance must have been drained using vlc_input_decoder_Drain() or flushed using vlc_input_decoder_Flush() after any previous call to vlc_input_decoder_Decode() before calling the destructor."  This will allow not flushing outputs when doing gapless transition.  Fixes #28463

decoder: move draining check  No functional changes as IsDrained() is only used by IsEmpty() internally.
decoder: add vlc_input_decoder_IsDrained()  Polling is still ugly, but I don't think it's wise to change this behavior in vout and aout for now.

macosx: Add VLCLibraryAudioDataSourceHeaderDelegate  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>

qt: do not signal current item change unnecessarily in `PlaylistController` #2  This was missed in 776121f3 because I thought, as the callback name implied, it would be called when the current item changed so checking if the current item changed would be redundant. However, the callback is actually for current index change, so we also have to compare the current item there before signalling the change to prevent unnecessarily signalling the change.
qt: rename playlist current item change callback in `PlaylistController`
qt: open an error dialog when saving metadata fails
meta: return a failure if no meta writer module is found in input_item_WriteMeta
macosx: Check for numberOfAudioDevices below 0  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix compile warnings in VLCMainMenu  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix compile warnings in VLCMain  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix compile warnings in VLCLibraryAudioViewController  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix compile warnings in VLCLibraryAlbumTableCellView  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix compile warnings in VLCLbraryCollectionViewFlowLayout  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Unify properties used to indicate if the library window is actively presenting video playback  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
macosx: Fix currently playing song's table view items (within album table view item's table views) losing boldness  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
test: add test for rbga picture format
lib: picture: add rgba format
ci: re-enable building snap package
snap: update to core22 and make it compatible with snapcraft 8
contrib: protobuf: prioritize internal include path over zlib include directories

apple: build.sh: always set target through compiler argument  Even when linking we should use the -m<os>-version-min argument and let the compiler set the proper low-level linker arguments instead of second-guessing it, and getting it wrong in cases like when building for aarch64 targeting 10.11, which never existed. Letting the compiler handle this will result in the proper outcome:   ld [...] -arch arm64 -platform_version macos 11.0.0 26.1

decoder: use an union for video/audio/spu  Make the structure a little more readable.  Every union variables are read after an es cat check, or from a es specific callback. I added an assert on es cat from these callbacks.
codec: webvtt: fix line/position alignment

qt: set in DComp compositor in failed state after unloadGUI has been called  we expect the compositor to not use mainCtx after unloadGUI has been called https://code.videolan.org/videolan/vlc/-/tree/2101c1258b171a75178e19a3f8bc1c6bab4000cf/modules/gui/qt/qt.cpp#L1191  But the setup phase is triggered asynchronously once the first frame renders. So we can skip the setup phase once in unloadGUI as we know we won't show the UI
macosx: Fix deadlock when playqueue playback finishes  Signed-off-by: Claudio Cambra <developer@claudiocambra.com>
demux: playlist: dvb: use ARRAY_SIZE
codec: uleaddvaudio: use ARRAY_SIZE
codec: mpg123: use ARRAY_SIZE
avcodec: encoder: use ARRAY_SIZE
demux: wav: use ARRAY_SIZE
demux: ogg: use ARRAY_SIZE
codec: x264: use ARRAY_SIZE
extras: tools: bootstrap: Do not add xz when tar is needed  We already do that in tools.mak. Moreover, it causes two xz targets to be created in the Makefile.
extras: tools: remove unnecessary xz dependency  tar depends on xz anyway.
extras: tools: bootstrap: rework makefile generation  Make sure all the targets are touched to stop unnecessary rebuilding.
contrib: dav1d: update to 1.5.2  "1.5.2 is a minor release of dav1d, focusing on minor speed optimizations, reduce code size and other small fixes on tools and compilation"
contrib: soxr: fix usage of libavutil tx  It requires aligned buffers, so we use the libavutil allocators as the original code.  And the stride is always sizeof(float).
modules: xcb: silence unused variable warning without xkb-common
modules: pva: do not read possibly uninitialized memory
modules: xcb: silence unused variables warnings
modules: vpx: ensure thread count can't be negative  Also resolves a warning about type conversion in the ternary and avoid evaluating vlc_GetCPUCount twice.

modules: aiff: rename and use array init for chunk id  Rename psz_name to chunk_id as clearly this is not a pointer to a zero terminated string. Also use an array initializer instead of a string literal, as we do not expect it to be NUL terminated.
modules: rtp: use uint_fast8_t for the loop variable as well
modules: rtp: use array initializer for hex chars  This buffer is not used as a string so does not need to be NUL terminated.
